pros: Friendly people, flexible work-culture, a great place to work.
cons: Despite peers' support, human rights is a tough area to work, often stressful.

review_title: Great place to work, high pressure, flexibility
pros: - flexibility around where you can work from and flex hours
cons: - high pressure given the nature of the work

review_title: Great environment but poor technology use
pros: Great people, great community and working hours are flexible
cons: Not an extensive use of technologies

pros: Do not waste your money donating
cons: Toxic and political culture. Donors would be appalled to see the wastage of their funds.

review_title: Australia office: Great brand for an organisation, fantastic cause but terrible management.
pros: A lot of the staff are very dedicated to the cause and very passionate about helping people.
cons:
Senior management appear to be hiding their inabilities to manage effectively. When there are bad decisions made, they appear to sweep it under the rug and move onto the next bad decision. There is no recourse for bad decisions and lessons are not learned so knowledge is not passed on.
The board don't seem to have a clear view of what is happening almost as though the senior management are filtering the information.

review_title: Great place to work, keep fighting the good fight
pros:
- new management structure, with impressive leaders ready to make a difference 
- really supportive work environment offering flexible working arrangements, additional leave and good salaries
cons: - can set some high targets and when strategies change due to external world all staff need to be onboard, and if not, they should probably be shown the door.

pros: There are some genuinely passionate, amazing people there
cons: Bullying was well-known to be happening, but HR and senior management didn't seem to want to deal with it - or even admit it was happening. No support given to victims. This led to massive staff churn in certain roles, which is a huge waste of money and resources in a charity that relies on donations from members of the public. Working here was hugely disillusioning in a charity that prides itself on its courage to stand up for human rights.

pros:
• Passionate staff, volunteers and activists
• Meaningful work
• Very good parental leave package
• Good remuneration
cons:
• Stressful work environment 
• Poor work-life balance
• Bullying allowed to happen with few or no consequences 
• Poor relations between staff and management (management’s fault)
• Poor physical and mental health outcomes for many staff
• Limited promotional opportunities (management seeking new external employees rather than focusing on investing in current staff)
• Staff expected to live and breathe organisational values that are not held up by management

review_title: Amazing cause, but appalling executive management in Australia
pros: Very worth cause with some incredibly dedicated and talented staff who are there to make a genuine difference.
cons: Executive management have no integrity, treat staff very poorly and actively hide their poor performance from the board. Extremely high staff turnover because of a lack of faith in management.

pros: Passionate and talented staff. Amazing cause.
cons: Bullying. Toxic environment.  Issues not actioned by senior management and HR. Eventually gave up speaking up.

pros: great organisation and fantastic cause to work for
cons: complex work culture and internal relationships

pros: taking a big salary via money from gullible wankers in the street
cons: Being brutalised with a rolling pin in the tea-room whilst bending over to find some sugar.
